<p>👋</p>



<p>I co-lead <a href="https://automattic.design/">design at Automattic</a>, where I work with a bunch of great people to make a better, more open web. I enjoy being outside in and around Seattle. Biking, snowboarding, camping, walking the dog, taking pictures, or some combination of those.</p>



<p>This site has been around in some form <a href="https://kelly.blog/2011/11/16/new-site/">since 2011</a>. It’s a bit of a playground and changes quite often. Both the design of it and what I blog about. Lately, I’ve been posting pictures. Take a look around and make sure to <a href="https://kelly.blog/contact/">say hello</a>.</p>

<div class="wp-block-template-part">
<div class="wp-block-group is-layout-constrained wp-block-group-is-layout-constrained"><div style="font-size:0.8rem;" class="wp-block-post-date"><time datetime="2024-10-15T15:46:59-07:00">October 15, 2024</time></div>

<h2 style="font-style:normal;font-weight:500;" class="wp-block-post-title"><a href="https://kelly.blog/2024/10/15/never-delegate-understanding/" target="_self" >Never delegate understanding</a></h2></div>


<div class="entry-content wp-block-post-content is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained">
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><a href="https://i0.wp.com/kelly.blog/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Eames-1080x525-1.jpg?ssl=1"><img data-recalc-dims="1" fetchpriority="high" decoding="async" width="1024" height="498" data-attachment-id="10223" data-permalink="https://kelly.blog/2024/10/15/never-delegate-understanding/eames-1080x525/" data-orig-file="https://i0.wp.com/kelly.blog/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Eames-1080x525-1.jpg?fit=1080%2C525&ssl=1" data-orig-size="1080,525" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{"aperture":"0","credit":"","camera":"","caption":"","created_timestamp":"0","copyright":"","focal_length":"0","iso":"0","shutter_speed":"0","title":"","orientation":"0"}" data-image-title="Eames-1080×525" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://i0.wp.com/kelly.blog/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Eames-1080x525-1.jpg?fit=300%2C146&ssl=1" data-large-file="https://i0.wp.com/kelly.blog/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Eames-1080x525-1.jpg?fit=1024%2C498&ssl=1" tabindex="0" role="button" src="https://i0.wp.com/kelly.blog/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Eames-1080x525-1.jpg?resize=1024%2C498&ssl=1" alt="" class="wp-image-10223" srcset="https://i0.wp.com/kelly.blog/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Eames-1080x525-1.jpg?resize=1024%2C498&ssl=1 1024w, https://i0.wp.com/kelly.blog/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Eames-1080x525-1.jpg?resize=300%2C146&ssl=1 300w, https://i0.wp.com/kelly.blog/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Eames-1080x525-1.jpg?resize=768%2C373&ssl=1 768w, https://i0.wp.com/kelly.blog/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Eames-1080x525-1.jpg?w=1080&ssl=1 1080w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" /></a></figure>



<p>I love the work of Charles and Ray Eames. I recently re-watched <strong><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q8vIESeiG-E">The Architect & The Painter</a></strong> and paused it to jot some notes on their design process:</p>



<p>The Eames design process, is a process of learning by doing. When designing something, it is often this connection that provides the key to the solution. </p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">“Never delegate understanding.”</h2>



<p>This is the hallmark of Eames design, their secret ingredient. “First you have an idea, then you discard the idea, then you have 50 other ideas and you discard them, and then you do several models, and they don’t work, and you throw them out. And the secret is work and work and work and work and work.”</p>



<hr class="wp-block-coblocks-dynamic-separator" style="height:50px"/>



<p>‘Never delegating understanding’ is such a great principle. Both when leading others and when designing. I often need to delegate or assign work to others. Whenever I’ve also delegated understanding— of the problem, the greater context, status of the work, or the final product shipped— usually something goes off track. When I am doing the work myself, my best work happens when I fully understanding the problem, the greater context, and the best outcome by working through as many ideas as possible.</p>
</div>

<h2 style="font-style:normal;font-weight:500;" class="wp-block-post-title"><a href="https://kelly.blog/2024/09/16/mt-baker-hill-climb/" target="_self" >Mt. Baker Hill Climb</a></h2></div>


<div class="entry-content wp-block-post-content is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained">
<p>I love a good climb and impulsively signed up for a 22-mile ride a few months ago. It started down the road from our favorite cabin rental in Glacier and ended a few miles past Mt. Baker Ski Area at Artist Point. I’ve driven this beautiful mountain pass so many times and thought it would be a fun challenge to bike it, especially with a large group and zero cars on the road. It was tough but really fun and I stopped to grab a snack at the two aid stations and to snap a few pictures. When I got to the top, I was excited for the ride back down. Was surprised that many took the shuttle down or had stashed their cars at the top.</p>

<h2 style="font-style:normal;font-weight:500;" class="wp-block-post-title"><a href="https://kelly.blog/2024/08/09/welcome-back/" target="_self" >Welcome back</a></h2></div>


<div class="entry-content wp-block-post-content is-layout-constrained wp-block-post-content-is-layout-constrained">
<p><a href="https://filippodt.com/2024/08/08/whats-new-at-automattic-the-boomerang-edition/">New post from Filippo</a>, a talented designer who recently joined Automattic for the second time. Some really great observations and I especially love this part:</p>



<blockquote class="wp-block-quote is-style-default is-layout-flow wp-block-quote-is-layout-flow" style="padding-top:0;padding-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--60);padding-bottom:0;padding-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--60)">
<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Design quality</h2>



<p class="is-style-default">The <a href="https://automattic.design/">quality of design work and thinking</a> has gotten better than when I was here last time. All our properties look more sophisticated and polished. So are our internal communications and templates.</p>



<p>You can tell the extra care and attention that goes into everything. Seeing this quality of work drives me to pay extra special attention to the details. I want to meet and exceed the standard that’s being said. It’s motivating.</p>
</blockquote>



<p>We’ve put a lot of work into improving the design quality over the past few years and I’m really happy its so apparent. Glad to have you back, Filippo!</p>
</div>
